name: Hampton Inn & Suites Carson City

reviews.title: Welcome Hampton Inn
reviews.text: Carson City needed some chain hotels. Yes, I know there are those of you out there that HATE chain hotels. I HATE chain restaurants. But as a business traveler, I need to have a clean, dependable hotel with consistant internet service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I live in the UK and were visiting the Lake Tahoe area, so we looked on the Internet to see if there was a Hampton or other Hilton group hotel in the area. Luckily the Carson City Hampton fitted the bill perfectly, as the hotel itself was beautifully appointed with lovely large rooms and nice comfy beds !!! as we are Hilton HHonors Gold Card members we even got an upgrade, but we noticed all the rooms in this hotel were excellent anyway !!! The free business centre Internet connection was very uselful to check personal e-mail etc, and make reservations at other group hotels as the holiday progresses. The staff were very nice and recommended nice places to eat in Carson City. The breakfast was of the usual high standard with hot food and cereals etc,. We would definitely stay there again next time we are in the area. Pam and Dave Phoenix, Knutsford. UK.
reviews.title: Better than average Hampton Inn
Good Location, Great Beds!
reviews.text: I stayed at this Hampton Inn for three nights to visit Lake Tahoe and the casinos in the surrounding areas. This hotel is new and everything is clean, tidy and very well appointed. The room was large and very comfortable. The bed was the best I've ever slept in. I want to know where they purchase their sheets and blankets. High speed internet is wired or wireless and works very well. Breakfast was great! Location wise the hotel is 30 minutes from Reno and about 45 minutes from Lake Tahoe. Overall, a great experience. I would definitely go back to this Hampton Inn.

I stayed here for two nights and found it to be a great hotel. It is very new and nicely decorated in a great contemporary style. The bed was very comfortable. It was very clean and well kept. It had a little microwave and fridge and a great little desk area. Although there is no bottled water offered in the room, you can buy it in the small little market area next to the front desk, as well as other little snacks and sundries. The breakfast was crowded but well stocked and had a good selection. My only complaint was that I stayed on the first floor and like clockwork each morning at 8:00 am it sounded like a heard of elephants above me as (presumably) the room above mine was being cleaned. I heard this even over the sound of the a/c and a white noise machine I use when I travel. I would recommend staying on the top floor if you can, to avoid the noise. Overall, a very nice hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Stay
Hampton Inn was VERY Nice
reviews.text: When I was searching for a place to stay in Carson City I was a little distressed at the poor reviews most of the hotels had received. It made me not want to stay in this city at all. I decided to pay a little more and booked our rooms at the Hampton. We got a great rate of about $98.

reviews.title: Outstanding Overnight Stay!
reviews.text: We were very pleasantly surprised to find it such a nice hotel. Our room was gorgeous and the hotel must be quite new. Everything was very clean. The bathroom was large and they supplied lots of nice fluffy towels, and all the little amenities such as special soaps, shower gel, and a note that if you'd forgotten anything else to just ring the front desk. The beds were very comfortable and lots of pillows to choose from. Our bill was delivered to the door so we didn't have to spend time checking out. I did notice in the night the smell of tobacco smoke in the bathroom....coming from the vents?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed two nights over New Years Eve 2007 because we didn't want to shell out the $$$ to stay in Reno or South Lake, but still wanted to be close.
reviews.title: Its no joke, it really is the best in Carson City.

likes.liked: — Beautiful accommodations, friendly staff and comfortable hotel.

reviews.text: The Hampton is brand new, easy to find (its the first thing you see as you come over the hill into Carson City), and a very comfortable place to rest your head.
reviews.title: This place has it all!

likes.liked: — Great comfy beds, super attitued of the staff

reviews.text: The rooms are modern and well-decorated, the beds comfortable and the service was very kind. The indoor heated pool and hot tub were great on those 20 degree nights. Continental breakfast is free and was quite tasty.
reviews.title: Very Happy with the Hampton Inn

reviews.text: There is also a free business center with a computer and fax machine that only requires your room key for access. They have a nice little gym, too, but we didn't use it.
reviews.title: Pleasant Hotel

reviews.text: The location is a bit far from everything in Carson City, so you're going to have to drive, but you pretty much have to drive everywhere there anyway. And of course you're only about a half an hour from South Lake Tahoe.
reviews.title: Great, Friendly Hotel

likes.liked: — Comfortable, quiet rooms and friendly staff
likes.disliked: — Hot breakfast could have been better

aka: Hampton Inn & Suites Carson City Hotel Carson City
